subject: RE: [junit] Creating MockObjects from Classes with Static Methods
msgSnippet: [Repost. Pardon the =20s and =2Es] Since static methods cannot be enforced in an interface, can you just change the static methods to something non-static?
messageBody:
[Repost. Pardon the =20s and =2Es]

Since static methods cannot be enforced in an interface, can you just
change the static methods to something non-static? Answering the question,=

"Why are these methods class level?" is the first step to a better
design=2E=

Perhaps you have another object creeping around in there, trying to get
out=2E Until that object gets out, mocking will be hellish=2E

If someone is calling the static method, they are definitely not doing it
through the ITaskGroup interface, so ignore the interface for the purposes=

of this discussion=2E Extract an object from the collection of static meth=
ods
and mock that new object=2E

Good luck=2E

Subject: [junit] Creating MockObjects from Classes with Static Methods



Hello !!

I've been spending some time lately trying to familiarise myself with=20
MockObjects=2E I've learned quite a bit but I'm having trouble=20
creating MockObjects from Classes that use Static Methods=2E

e=2Eg=2E=20

public class TaskGroup implements ITaskGroup {
=20
public static void execute() {
// Implementation of method
}

// =2E=2E=2E
//=20
// Remaining TaskGroup code =2E=2E=2E
//=20
// =2E=2E=2E=20

}


In this case a MockObject must extend TaskGroup instead of=20
implementing ITaskGroup=2E =20

Is this the only way to go about creating MockObjects from such=20
classes? Is there a refactoring pattern I could employ that would=20
allow me to Mock the Interface instead of the Concreate Class?

I have considered placing all static methods in an abstract TaskGroup=20
and causing each method to immediately throw a=20
java=2Elang=2EUnsupportedOperation Exception=2E This allows me to create =
a=20
MockObject from the abstract class (i=2Ee=2E The mockobject does not=20
extend the domain code) but this approach strikes me as very=20
questionable design=2E

I'd appreciate any suggestions, web links or general abuse=2E

Rob=2E
